title: A Framework for Measures of Risk under Uncertainty. (arXiv:2110.10792v2 [q-fin.RM] UPDATED)
abstract: A risk analyst assesses potential financial losses based on multiple sources of information. Often, the assessment does not only depend on the specification of the loss random variable but also various economic scenarios. Motivated by this observation, we design a unified axiomatic framework for risk evaluation principles which quantifies jointly a loss random variable and a set of plausible probabilities. We call such an evaluation principle a generalized risk measure. We present a series of relevant theoretical results. The worst-case, coherent, and robust generalized risk measures are characterized via different sets of intuitive axioms. We establish the equivalence between a few natural forms of law invariance in our framework, and the technical subtlety therein reveals a sharp contrast between our framework and the traditional one. translated_title: 不确定性下风险度量的框架
translated_abstract: 风险分析师根据多个信息来源评估潜在的财务损失。通常，评估不仅取决于损失随机变量的规范，还取决于不同的经济情景。受到这一观察的启发，我们设计了一个统一的公理框架，用于风险评估原则，同时量化损失随机变量和一组可能的概率。我们将这样的评估原则称为广义风险度量。我们提出了一系列相关的理论结果。通过不同的直观公理，我们表征了最坏情况、连贯和稳健的广义风险度量。我们在框架中建立了几种自然形式的法律不变性之间的等价性，并且其中的技术细微之处展示了我们的框架与传统框架之间的鲜明对比。此外，连贯性和强法律不变性是通过其他条件的组合推导出来的，这为连贯风险提供了额外的支持。
tldr: 本文提出了一个统一的框架用于不确定性下的风险度量。通过量化损失随机变量和一组可能的概率，我们设计了广义风险度量评估原则，并通过不同的公理来表征最坏情况、连贯和稳健的风险度量。我们还建立了几种自然形式的法律不变性之间的等价性，并发现我们的框架与传统框架之间的鲜明对比。此外，连贯性和强法律不变性是通过其他条件的组合推导出来的，为连贯风险提供了额外的支持。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a unified framework for measuring risk under uncertainty. By quantifying both the random variable of loss and a set of plausible probabilities, we design evaluation principles for generalized risk measures, characterizing the worst-case, coherent, and robust measures through different axioms. We establish the equivalence between various forms of law invariance, revealing a sharp contrast between our framework and the traditional one. Additionally, coherence and strong law invariance are derived from a combination of other conditions, providing further support for coherent risk.
